intro: Calotis scabriuscula var. lobata, commonly known as the rough calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and open woodlands. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a hardy species suitable for cultivation in arid regions.
